args:
After the party nullifies the interloper controlling
Bahamut, Nedrick announces that he cannot
abide Zethia's pact with the dragon and
threatens to claim it by force. Pressed into
action, the party takes him on to save her.
Grant me the power of shapeshifting in\naccordance with our pact, O Bahamut!
(I have to find the foreign element in\nthe pact's connection and mana flow.\nIt must be here somewhere...)
...Are we back at the Sacred Tree?\nWait, and how's Zethia?!
Based on your appearance, I assume\nyou have regained Bahamut's power?
Yes. I can feel his will again, and the\nstrange feeling from right before I was\ncontrolled is gone.
Well, that's great and all, but I'm still\nwondering who the heck had the ability\nand sand to take control of Bahamut!
It must have been a being of equal power;\na fellow creator of the world entire.\nSomething akin to the Progenitor.

Were that the case, we should have seen
more interference from the Progenitor—
or Phares, as that is the form it appears
he has now claimed.
(He's right. It was not the Progenitor.\nBut it felt very similar. Which could\nmean...)
...Regardless of who it is that's trying to\ncontrol Bahamut, there is one thing we\nhave learned.
You cannot resist the control of this\nbeing alone, Zethia.
Had we not saved you, you would have\nbecome a mindless puppet of this\nmystery individual.

The present threat it represents may have
dissipated for the moment, but that doesn't
mean we've cut the problem out; the being
will likely attempt to seize control again.
Clearly, you cannot be trusted with even\na portion of Bahamut's pact. As such,\nyou must surrender it to me at once.
Hang on, Nedrick! Yes, Zethia may have\nbeen controlled for a moment, but we\nwere able to get her back to normal!
Yeah, and if it happens again, we'll just\ngang up and save her again!

And therein lies the rub: How can we
guarantee the same people will all be
gathered together and ready to act if she
again falls under this being's sway?
At a minimum, it would require me, Jin,\nAudric, and {player_name}.
The four of us cannot simply stand by\nZethia's side until the end of time.
Zethia, relinquish your pact to me.\nIt is the only way to save this world—\nand yourself.
And why not? What is the issue?
You are an intelligent and rational person,\nNedrick, which is exactly why I cannot give\nyou the whole of Bahamut's power.
I know you haven't cast aside your plan to\ngive all people the power of shapeshifting.
If I relinquish Bahamut's power to you,\nyou will be able to realize that plan.\nTHIS is the issue.

There is a certain road near at hand
and an uncertain one in the distance.
It is not difficult to guess which one you,
a logical man, would ultimately choose.
You see the world clearly, Nedrick.\nBut do you know its people?
What are you trying to say?
You want to save those without power,\nyet are you certain each and every one\nof them desires the same?
You believe every person who lacks power\nseeks it, down to the very last.

This is because you were once one of
these powerless. Raised amid misfortune,
you instead used your poor circumstances
to hone yourself. This is a splendid thing.
But not everyone can be like you,\nnor does everyone desire to be.
I cannot bring myself to entrust the power\nover an entire world to a man who does\nnot understand that.
If I could save the world while making\nsure each and every person was amenable\nto the method, I would.
But as this is clearly impossible, we have\nno choice but to show them how things\nmight be—to show them an ideal.
And this ideal is you, I take it? Ha!\nYou're more of a dreamer than I thought.
I have no interest in attempting to work\nwith someone who believes that they alone\ncan save the world.
Even with the best of intentions, power\nconcentrated in one place is the seed\nof tyranny, and I will not abide it.

Yet this is no fool's dream, for I have the
will and ability to make it so. Someone
must step forward and pave the way for
the future, or none will ever follow.
But can you truly bear it, Nedrick?
I experienced for myself a fraction of\nBahamut's vast power.
The burden of a full pact is unimaginable.

No matter how talented, determined, and
prepared you are, I do not think you can
withstand containing the entirety of the
Wyrm of Genesis within you.

You're right—and I suppose you would
know from experience. Remember how you
were temporarily controlled by Bahamut?
And that wasn't even a complete pact!
The same unease you feel for Zethia would\nhaunt us, which is why we're better off\nleaving things as they are.
We do this for BOTH of your sakes.
Don't you people see that stagnation is\nunacceptable? Doing nothing means only\nthat nothing will change!
Okay, so I don't understand...uh, any of\nthis, but I DO believe in Zethia!
And if she doesn't want you doing this,\nyou better just back the heck off!
Clearly I cannot make you understand.\nSo be it. If I must go forward alone,\nthat is exactly what I will do.
If you will not surrender your pact,\nZethia, then I will take it by force!
...And so you stand in my path again,\n{player_name}.
Your talents and strength are impressive,\nNedrick, but you're not the only one in\nthe world with such power!
Why does everything have to end in a\nfight with you?! Why are you always SO\ndetermined to do everything alone?!
You do not understand, and I grow weary\nof attempting to explain it.
This is what I need to be true to myself!
